channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024100294
item.description:
Report E-2024100294

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: SEDGWICK
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGN experienced an over the road UN1197 Caramel FMF Liquid Conc Flavor release from a 30- gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted trailer floor to clean the release. The damaged empty tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE into a 95-gallon poly drum. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100297
item.description:
Report E-2024100297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a jerrican that was staged on a pallet slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a protruding nail from the pallet the jerrican was staged on had punctured the bottom of the jerrican consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbents and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

item.title: Report X-2024100583
item.description:
Report X-2024100583

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING DURING TRAILER UNLOAD. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THERE ARE THIRTY-FIVE VARIOUS PERFUMES AND COLOGNES SURROUNDED BY FOAM WRAPPING INSIDE THE BOX. THE LEAK WAS CAUSED BY A SINGLE 125 ML BOTTLE OF DIESEL FUEL FOR LIFE COLOGNE BEING SHATTERED. THE GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING IS THE ONLY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATOR ON THE PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024100289
item.description:
Report E-2024100289

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: CAROLINA
  • State: PR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM PUERTO RICO TO DOMINICAN REPUBLIC WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX WAS UN SPECIFICATION WITHOUT ANY APPLIED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. UPON INSPECTION THERE ARE EIGHT SMALL ONE OUNCE BOTTLES OF EXTRACTS WITH FLAMMABLE GHS PICTOGRAMS. THE OUTER BOX DOES NOT HAVE AN EXCEPTED QUANTITY MARK APPLIED. INVOICE DESCRIBES CONTENTS AS ARTIFICAL FLAVORS. THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTION IS SAMPLE FLAVORS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024100295
item.description:
Report E-2024100295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN2735 Baxxodur EC301 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of Baxxodur EC301 released to a 100’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot and a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a metal plate which slid within the trailer during transport. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas to clean the release. The impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was removed from site for disposal.

item.description:

  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 2, 2024, two (2) 1.5 gallon jugs of hydrogen peroxide were damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, cleaners, and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and three (3) 35-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On October 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3077 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately sixteen (16) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the site. EXE personnel utilized a vacuum unit to remediate the UN3077-impacted trailer. The unaffected freight was restacked and rewrapped onsite for future terminal use. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100291
item.description:
Report E-2024100291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-29
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 29, 2024, at 1107 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Elgin, Nebraska regarding the release of Acetone. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 16 ounces of Acetone (UN1090, 3, II) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to a faulty nozzle, and there was no impact to the trailer floor as all material was caught on a rag. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Contactors transferred all remaining material to a new 275-gallon plastic tote. The damaged tote was the only waste generated from this incident which was then taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100286
item.description:
Report E-2024100286

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: BELGRADE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 27, 2024 at 1603 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Belgrade, Montana regarding the release of Sikafloor-265 Part B. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 quart of Sikafloor-265 Part B (UN3066, 8, II) from (1) 5-gallon steel pail onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a loading error, impacting a 2' x 1' area in the trailer and dripping outside of the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drums, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 25, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN3149 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE personnel utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. Allimpacted materials were containerized in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2024100527

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Alan Fozo Service Center Manager called safety to report report evidence of a spill in trailer 84740, UN1648, ACETONITRILE 3 PG II. 1 Gallon pail. Alan stated when the crew opened the trailer door on the trailer and started to unload, they found a box that looked to have been forked by a forklift. A lan stated the only evidence of the spill was the hole in the box and a damaged 1 gallon pail in the box that was dry. Alan stated it looks like the ACETONITRILE had evaporated and left no trace of the spill. Alan stated he was going to take the damaged pail and place it in a recovery pail with Pro Number in OSD. Alan stated after removing the pallet and the box from the skid, there was no spill to be cleaned other than a damaged glass pail in the box. Alan stated the box that was damaged by the forklift blade was done at the loading facility and found the damaged box at SC 106 in trailer 847 40 while unloading.

item.title: Report E-2024100216
item.description:
Report E-2024100216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released paint in the trailer and on the dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted freight with absorbent pads and degreaser. All spent absorbents, the empty pail, and all cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum

  • Description: On September 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. FCE personnel utilized absorbents to remediate the site. All absorbents and deconstructed pallets were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On September 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was shipped with a faulty gasket and released approximately one (1) teaspoon of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel wiped down the drum with absorbent wipes until a neutral pH reading was confirmed. The leaking poly drum was placed into one (1) 75-gallon overpack for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024100266
item.description:
Report E-2024100266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/19/24 at 2:45am, shortly after refueling at Loves Truck Stop in Port Allen, LA, an OxyChem truck driver noticed liquid coming from the drain tube for the trailer’s dome. The driver immediately pulled to the side of the road to inspect the trailer. Upon inspection, three of the dome lugs were less than tool tight. The driver immediately notified OxyChem dispatch and OxyChem management. A third-party technician responded and tightened the lugs. The driver performed a slosh test and discovered the dome was still not sealed. The OxyChem Response Team responded and temporarily secured the dome to prevent leakage during movement to a nearby truck repair facility. The OxyChem Response team then replaced the dome gasket, which resolved the issue. The LA State Police Hazmat was notified. There are no injuries, exposures, damage, or environmental impact.

item.title: Report E-2024100269
item.description:
Report E-2024100269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: GRAPEVINE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UAC Intl
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Another IAC arranged the delivery of the freight by shipper to our facility on Sep 18th, 2024. As an IAC-CCSF, we were advised to screen & transfer the freight to the air carrier of the shipment for airlines booking made via the other IAC. There was a pick up truck which arrived to our facility to deliver the crate and when the driver was asked to provide proper identification and sign our check-in sheet, he left w/o either. We, UAC INT'L, notified the IAC about this incident. Due to the suspicious delivery activity, we opened the crate which we did not accept on behalf of the IAC and discovered 3 loose Lithium Ion Batteries in the crate. We notified the IAC and DFW TSA of the incident accordingly.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0824ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal XAE. It was reported that approximately 8 ounces of Linc Clean 2760M released from (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to punctures on top corners of the tote that had tape covering it. The release impacted the trailer floor and other freight. The contractors transferred the product to a new 275-poly tote, cut up and containerized the damaged tote, cleaned and neutralized the impacted area with vinegar. All impacted waste material was placed into a poly lined flex ben along with cut-up tote and staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1242 ET, XPO-NLB notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately unknown amount of an Spectrum DT1402 product released from 55-gallon plastic drum due to shrink wrap to tight causing a pinhole puncture at the crease. The release impacted inside trailer#463-7525. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors overpacked the drum to (1) 65-gallon metal drum, product impacted and neutralized absorbents, soil and poly sheeting into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1134 ET, XPO terminal LTY notified ERTS of a cargo refused shipment that took place 08/2024. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Amazing Product Liquid Fire Drain Line Opener released from (1) 1-ounce plastic container due to reasons unknown. The release impacted cardboard box the product is overpacked in. The release has since dried, as it happened over a month ago but was just today sent back to them from the customer. The terminal will reach out to the shipper to see if shipper would like the product returned to them. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri as an absorbent and a 30-gallon poly drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

Employee performing spill clean-up used PPE including a respirator due to the strong odor. Several employees complained of itchy burning throats, one employee complained of respiratory problems. The employee with respiratory problems went to the clinic the following day but was not admitted to the hospital. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

Safety advised Kirk Smith the freight is not PIH. Reagan Cowdrey with Cura was contacted for remediat ion. Safety will update the spill report.

item.title: Report E-2024100174
item.description:
Report E-2024100174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Chem-Trend PU-11434. A contractor dispatched and discovered a pinhole puncture at the bottom of the tote. The contractor observed a 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area. Oil dry was applied on the release product. The pinhole puncture was patched and the tote was placed into a spill bag until a new tote is delivered to perform a transfer. One drum of waste was generated containing the impacted oil dry. XPO will manage all waste. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN3082 Surfonic JL-80X release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor, and a 15' x 8' area of the concrete lot below. The drum was punctured by a forklift. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were then containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024100180

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ experienced a UN1824 Sodium Hydroxide Caustic Soda 50% release from (3) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor, a 15' x 15' area of the concrete lot below, and an 8' x 8' area of the concrete dock. The leaking drums were each placed into a 65-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were utilized to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Pkg was removed from flow at this location. Pkg missing required Hazmat Certification and OP-900LL tear-away Hazmat tags. No markings on plastic Pelican composite case.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF EMORY DRY ICE COOLING SOUTHERN BAKED PIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS HISSING. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED UN1956 COMPRESSED GAS, N.O.S. (NITROGEN DIOXIDE, NITROGEN) WITH THE CLASS 2.2 DIAMOND LABEL AND IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE CYLINDER LEAKING. THE RESPONDER REMOVED THE CAP AND TIGHTENED THE VALVE TO STOP THE LEAK.

  • Description: TIFU 126964 was reported releasing a steady amount of gasoline. United Pumping was dispatched to the container to assess and remediate. United Pumping reported the valve was damaged when it was set on the chassis by a cap that was not installed on the valve dangling from the securement cable. The cap became caught between the valve and the frame of the chassis causing damage to the flange bolts. The container was lifted off of the chassis and the obstruction was removed. The bolts were able to be tightened stopping the release.

item.title: Report I-2024080122
item.description:
Report I-2024080122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: RATHDRUM
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CITYSERVICEVALCON, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 223191
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Truck was traveling north with cruise control set at 61 mph and failed to negotiate a turn. Truck tracked off right side of road onto soft shoulder comprised of sand and gravel. Driver over-corrected and slowed which caused. trailer to jack-knife and overturn onto roadway. Impact of trailer to roadway and abrasion from dragging along road caused two compartments of trailer to be breached. Trailer terminated across both lanes of highway. Trailer sustained damage to rear and center compartments. Rear compartment was damaged due to impact that caused a greater than 12-inch crack along the outer trailer wall and internal vertical wall between rear and center compartment. Center compartment sustained multiple pittings and an approximate 4-inch vertical crack on the side that abraded along roadway (See attached pictures). Absorbent materials consisting of pads, booms and granular matter was dispensed immediately. Emergency response and spill response crews were notified and cleanup activities began immediately by pumping out remaining contents of trailer and removing trailer from roadway along with cleanup of roadway and visible fuel. Soil excavation activities began on August 5, 2024 upon receipt of encroachment permit from Idaho Department of Transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024100148
item.description:
Report E-2024100148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, SulfaTrap R7J from a supersac. The supersac was punctured by a piece of pallet. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5lb release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x2’ area. The supersac was transferred into two flex-bins that will ship on to the Consignee. One drums of waste was generated containing the released product, impacted PPE, cardboard and the damaged supersac. XPO will manage all of the waste from this No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/2/2024 at approximately 1245, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained 4 glass bottles of petroleum crude oil. The package was damaged by mechanical equipment, resulting in one of the glass bottles breaking and spilling. There is no secondary containment or positive closure. The cushioning between the bottles was insufficient. The broken glass and damaged outer package were placed in a salvage drum for proper disposal and the remaining bottles were placed in a separate drum, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for futher transport.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, K-Kleen SP. A contractor was dispatched and observed approximately 2-gallons released from one 55-gallon DF that fell over during transit due to improper blocking and bracing. An estimated 12’x6’ area of the wooden trailer floor was impacted and oil dry was applied. The damaged drum was overpacked into one 85-gallon DF along with the impacted oil dry. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from this response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding the release of hazardous product, WRXSOL-ECO-CR from a 330-gallon tote. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 10-gallon release from a crack in the tote that impacted the inside of the trailer (floors and walls) in a 10’x8.5’ area. The contractor neutralized the impacted area using backing soda and performed a tote transfer. The damaged tote was neutralized and taken for disposal by the Contractor. No other waste was generated from this response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

JT stated the damaged pail looks to have been crushed causing a spill of 64oz of the UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S on the trailer floor. JT stated one of the dock workers started to re stack the pallet on a new skid and JT advised he told the dock worker to stop work and he was g oing to call the spill into safety. JT stated the spill was made possible from improper blocking embracing.~

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE DISCOVERED ONE STEEL DRUM DAMAGED AND LEAKING. THE DRUM WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1993 FLAMMABLE LIQUID NOS WITH AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION THERE IS A HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE STEEL DRUM AND THE SIDES OF THE DRUM ARE DENTED FROM UNKNOWN SOURCES. APPROXIMATELY 3 L OF THE 13.6 L QUANTITY LEAKED FROM THE DRUM. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT X61148, ADHESIVE SYSTEMS, 9411 CORSAIR RD FRANKFORT IL 60423.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 25, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN2693 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and tote exterior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged tote and wrapped it. AS personnel utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail. On September 30, 2024, the crew returned to perform a tote transfer. The damaged tote and all cleanup debris were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO BY DESIGNATED RESPONDER AFTER A CALL WAS RECEIVED FROM THE PD1 OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR. PACKAGE WAS BEING PREPARED FOR LOADING WHEN INTERIOR CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE (AIR BAG), DEPLOYED INSIDE BOX. A CORNER OF THE PACKAGE CAUGHT FIRE AND WAS IMMEDIATELY PUT OUT BY THE AREA SUPERVISOR, ALL EVENTS OCCURING BEFORE DESIGNATED RESPONDERS HAD BEEN ALERTED. PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED AND BROUGHT BACK TO DMP. H S SUPERVISOR, BASE SUPERVISOR, AND SORT MANAGER WERE ALERTED TO THE EVENT. PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED TO FIND THE STEERING COLUMN WITH AIR BAG DEPLOYED, NO INTERIOR PACKAGING, NO EXTERNAL HAZARDOUS MARKINGS, AND WAS PREPARED IN A REUSED FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024100128
item.description:
Report E-2024100128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 500-gallons of gasoline released from one (1) tanker truck due to the driver attempting to switch trailers, but the weight was too heavy, causing the landing gear to go through the bottom of the trailer and the tank fell on the ground. The release impacted the asphalt parking lot and ditch that is in the center of the parking lot. Emergency response contractor HEPACO arrived on site and performed an initial clean up and collected an estimated 11,000 gallons of Liquid waste from the ditch and placed it into a frac-tank. The soil ditch area is pending remediation. No storm drains were reported impacted by the release.

item.description:
Report X-2024100145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Train crew witnessed the car release from the top. Code 3, contractor, SRS, and HMM were enroute. Car vented again upon arrival of the contractor. The car was inspected, and the pressure was 275 psi and less than zero on the gauging rod. It was determined that the car was overloaded. Highway transports and residue cars were mobilized to the Pine Bluff yard. The car vented two more times before being reduced to trucks. Car reduced to 14.5" of outage and the pressure was 155.

item.title: Report E-2024100149
item.description:
Report E-2024100149

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia personnel visited Santa Clara Valley Medical Center to collect various types of universal waste. Among the items were two 5-gallon pails containing lithium-ion batteries. The Veolia team carefully inspected each battery to ensure there was no bulging or damage, and verified that the terminals were properly protected with tape. The following morning, as Veolia employees were unloading waste from a box truck for trans-loading at Veolia's intransit facility, one worker noticed smoke emanating from one of the pails containing lithium-ion batteries. Acting swiftly, the employee removed the smoking 5-gallon pail from the truck and isolated it outdoors. The affected battery was allowed to complete its reaction process safely. Subsequently, the remaining batteries were separated and thoroughly re-examined. As a precautionary measure, each lithium-ion battery was individually bagged, and packed with fire suppressant media. Following this incident, all lithium-ion batteries were treated as damaged or defective and packaged in accordance with the 49 CFR 173.185(f) regulations. The second pail of lithium batteries underwent the same rigorous re-examination and packaging process to ensure safety and compliance.

  • Description: On 9/5/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5028110 at the station location in Stockton, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists of one metal cylinder packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered making a hissing sound. Further investigation revealed the cylinder was accidentally discharging inside of the box. The cause is the discharge is unknown. The shipment was isolated from other packages and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1739ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal XWB. It was reported that an unknown amount of Acid N released from (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to puncture from the metal part of a strap. The release is impacting the trailer floor, is releasing heavily, and starting to leak out onto the concrete yard. Terminal personnel are putting speedy dry around the release to try to contain it. The caller reported the tote is punctured on the side about 4" from the bottom and will be empty by the time a contractor arrives on site. Contractors recovered Acid N product, impacted absorbents, pads, and plastic in (18) 55-gallon poly drums. The drums were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to handle.

item.title: Report E-2024100054
item.description:
Report E-2024100054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XMI experienced a UN2815 Aminoethylpiperazine-HP release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to an 8' x 15' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 28' area of the concrete and asphalt lot below. The drum was punctured by a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were then utilized to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and cleanup debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100059
item.description:
Report E-2024100059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: DIEGEM
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5900
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE FROM HONG KONG TO BELGIUM WAS DISCOVERED EMITTING SMOKE WHILE TRAVELING ON THE CONVEYOR SYSTEM IN THE UPS DIEGEM BELGIUM FACILITY. THE PACKAGE BEGAN GENERATING HEAVY SMOKE TRIGGERING THE FIRE ALARM SYSTEM AND AN EVACUATION OF THE BUILDING. WHEN THE LOCAL FIRE BRIGADE ARRIVED THE BATTERY EVENT HAD SLOWED DOWN ALLOWING THE PACKAGE TO BE SECURED BY THE FIRE BRIGADE IN A WATER TANK TO PREVENT REACTIVATION OF THE EVENT. THE INCIDENT PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965. THE PACKAGE HAD AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AND HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT IN HONG KONG. THE PACKAGE WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON SEPTEMBER 25, 2024, UNDER REPORT 1411829.

  • City: PHOENIX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 24, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums, and one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon steel over-pack.

  • Description: On September 24, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of tommy's express presoak #1 was damaged by a faulty skid and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 30-gallon drum of product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On September 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide solution was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans separated by a fiberboard divider, positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. The lid on one can was open spilling the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

Report E-2024100047

  • City: ELKHART

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quarts of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel properly cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100048
item.description:
Report E-2024100048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3214 was shipped with a faulty cap and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove all residual product from the impacted surfaces. The impacted wood, spent absorbent pads, spent granular absorbents, and all UN3214 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum

  • City: Mirabel
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1555, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3871364 at the ramp facility in Mirabel, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, containing multiple boxes of safety matches. The shipment was flagged and stopped by Customs Clearance based on suspicious x-ray images. Further investigation revealed 250 boxes of matches as inner contents in each box. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, not including the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
